intro: Hieracium sparsum subsp. ottomalicum, commonly known as the Ottomalic mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. It has hairy, silver-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
